page.title: 04Hankham village
page.content: Hankham is a small village which is mentioned in the Domesday book:-It says"In hankham the count has 1 hide and \ of virgate.King Edward held it .land for 1 plough .No return from it." On an old map dated 1875 we found Hankham spelt 'Hancome' and yet on an earlier one, suposed to have been 1724,it was spelt Hankham again. We do not know the reason for this change.The village lies on a hill ridge which was once part of a penisular surrouned by the sea,this was in the days when Pevensey itself was a port. The sea went nearly Hailsham Station and on up towards Magham Down.
